{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Customer Care Representative",
  "description": "TeamAce Limited - Our client, a reputable organization in the telecommunications sector, is&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Care Representative
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As the Customer Care Representative, you will be responsible for providing prompt and professional support to customers, resolving inquiries and complaints, and ensuring a positive customer experience across all communication channels.


Responsibilities


	Respond to customer inquiries, complaints, and service requests via phone, email, and other channels
	Provide accurate information on products, services, billing, and technical issues
	Log, track, and resolve customer issues in line with service level standards
	Escalate complex cases appropriately and follow up to ensure resolution.


Requirements


	Minimum of HND / Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in any discipline
	At least 2 years of experience in a customer service or call center role, preferably in telecoms
	Strong communication skills with good problem-solving ability
	Computer literacy and familiarity with CRM or customer support systems.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 / month.",

  "validThrough": "2026-02-15",

Customer Care Representative Job at TeamAce Limited




        
    

        
        TeamAce Limited - Our client, a reputable organization in the telecommunications sector, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Care Representative
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As the Customer Care Representative, you will be responsible for providing prompt and professional support to customers, resolving inquiries and complaints, and ensuring a positive customer experience across all communication channels.


Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Respond to customer inquiries, complaints, and service requests via phone, email, and other channels
	Provide accurate information on products, services, billing, and technical issues
	Log, track, and resolve customer issues in line with service level standards
	Escalate complex cases appropriately and follow up to ensure resolution.


Requirements


	Minimum of HND / Bachelor’s Degree in any discipline
	At least 2 years of experience in a customer service or call center role, preferably in telecoms
	Strong communication skills with good problem-solving ability
	Computer literacy and familiarity with CRM or customer support systems.


Salary
N200,000 - N250,000 / month.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Key Account Manager (Healthcare)",
  "description": "Castville Solutions is a recruitment and business solutions provider specializing in the healthcare sector. We focus on connecting healthcare facilities with highly skilled professionals, enabling efficient operations, and driving business growth. Our services extend to recruitment, Templates for process and operations management, SOP development, and healthcare-specific training, with a clear mission to transform the healthcare workforce and operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Key Account Manager (Healthcare)

Job Location:&nbsp;Gbagada, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Key Account Manager (KAM) will be responsible for developing, managing, and expanding relationships with strategic healthcare clients.
	The role focuses on driving revenue growth, ensuring customer satisfaction, and serving as the primary point of contact for key accounts such as hospitals, pharmacy chains, HMOs, distributors, and healthcare institutions.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and grow relationships with key healthcare accounts, including hospitals, clinics, pharmacies, and distributors.
	Develop account plans to achieve sales targets and long-term business objectives.
	Identify new business opportunities within existing accounts and cross-sell products and services.
	Serve as the main liaison between clients and internal teams (sales, operations, supply chain, finance).
	Negotiate contracts, pricing, and service-level agreements in line with company policies.
	Monitor account performance, sales trends, and market activities.
	Ensure timely delivery of products and resolution of client issues.


Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Pharmacy, Life Sciences, or a related field.
	3&ndash;6 years of experience in key account management, sales, or business development within the healthcare or pharmaceutical sector.
	Strong understanding of healthcare markets, procurement processes, and institutional sales.
	Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.
	Excellent negotiation, relationship management, and communication skills.
	Experience with CRM tools and sales reporting systems.


Salary
N650,000 / Month.",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-14",
  "validThrough": "2026-02-11",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Castville Solutions"
    
  },

Key Account Manager (Healthcare) Job at Castville Solutions




        
    

        
        Castville Solutions is a recruitment and business solutions provider specializing in the healthcare sector. We focus on connecting healthcare facilities with highly skilled professionals, enabling efficient operations, and driving business growth. Our services extend to recruitment, Templates for process and operations management, SOP development, and healthcare-specific training, with a clear mission to transform the healthcare workforce and operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Key Account Manager (Healthcare)

Job Location: Gbagada, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Key Account Manager (KAM) will be responsible for developing, managing, and expanding relationships with strategic healthcare clients.
	The role focuses on driving revenue growth, ensuring customer satisfaction, and serving as the primary point of contact for key accounts such as hospitals, pharmacy chains, HMOs, distributors, and healthcare institutions.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage and grow relationships with key healthcare accounts, including hospitals, clinics, pharmacies, and distributors.
	Develop account plans to achieve sales targets and long-term business objectives.
	Identify new business opportunities within existing accounts and cross-sell products and services.
	Serve as the main liaison between clients and internal teams (sales, operations, supply chain, finance).
	Negotiate contracts, pricing, and service-level agreements in line with company policies.
	Monitor account performance, sales trends, and market activities.
	Ensure timely delivery of products and resolution of client issues.


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Pharmacy, Life Sciences, or a related field.
	3–6 years of experience in key account management, sales, or business development within the healthcare or pharmaceutical sector.
	Strong understanding of healthcare markets, procurement processes, and institutional sales.
	Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets.
	Excellent negotiation, relationship management, and communication skills.
	Experience with CRM tools and sales reporting systems.


Salary
N650,000 / Month.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Front End Field Technician",
  "description": "Open Access Consulting Limited - Our client, a leading company in the Internet Service Provider (ISP) and ICT solutions sector. The organization provides high-speed connectivity, internet solutions, CCTV, and IT support services to homes, offices, hospitals, and schools across Nigeria

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front End Field Technician
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview


	Th Front-End Field Technician to install, maintain, and troubleshoot customer hardware, network devices, and connectivity equipment across Lagos and surrounding states.


Responsibilities


	Install internet equipment (routers, microwave links, dongles) at customer sites.
	Diagnose and fix network connectivity or hardware issues on-site.
	Perform routine maintenance checks on equipment.
	Educate customers on device usage and basic troubleshooting.
	Coordinate with the operations team to plan field schedules.


Requirements


	Diploma/B.Sc/HND in Electronics, ICT, Computer Engineering, or related field.
	2+ years of field experience in network installation or telecom support.
	Working knowledge of connectivity devices and wireless equipment.


Skill Set;


	Hands-on technical skills with network hardware.
	Good communication and customer-relation abilities.
	Ability to work independently and in teams.


Salary
N3,000,000 - N3,600,000 per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;career@openaccessconsult.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2026-01-31",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

  },

Front End Field Technician Job at Open Access Consulting Limited




        
    

        
        Open Access Consulting Limited - Our client, a leading company in the Internet Service Provider (ISP) and ICT solutions sector. The organization provides high-speed connectivity, internet solutions, CCTV, and IT support services to homes, offices, hospitals, and schools across Nigeria

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Front End Field Technician
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

            
    




	Th Front-End Field Technician to install, maintain, and troubleshoot customer hardware, network devices, and connectivity equipment across Lagos and surrounding states.


Responsibilities


	Install internet equipment (routers, microwave links, dongles) at customer sites.
	Diagnose and fix network connectivity or hardware issues on-site.
	Perform routine maintenance checks on equipment.
	Educate customers on device usage and basic troubleshooting.
	Coordinate with the operations team to plan field schedules.


Requirements


	Diploma/B.Sc/HND in Electronics, ICT, Computer Engineering, or related field.
	2+ years of field experience in network installation or telecom support.
	Working knowledge of connectivity devices and wireless equipment.


Skill Set;


	Hands-on technical skills with network hardware.
	Good communication and customer-relation abilities.
	Ability to work independently and in teams.


Salary
N3,000,000 - N3,600,000 per month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: career@openaccessconsult.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventory and Warehouse Lead (Healthcare)",
  "description": "Castville Solutions is a recruitment and business solutions provider specializing in the healthcare sector. We focus on connecting healthcare facilities with highly skilled professionals, enabling efficient operations, and driving business growth. Our services extend to recruitment, Templates for process and operations management, SOP development, and healthcare-specific training, with a clear mission to transform the healthcare workforce and operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory and Warehouse Lead&nbsp;(Healthcare)

Job Location:&nbsp;Gbagada, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The Inventory Manager will be responsible for overseeing and controlling the procurement, storage, distribution, and tracking of medical supplies, pharmaceuticals, equipment, and consumables.
	The role ensures optimal stock levels, compliance with healthcare regulations, reduction of wastage, and uninterrupted availability of critical healthcare items.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage daily inventory operations for medical supplies, drugs, equipment, and consumables.
	Monitor stock levels to prevent shortages, overstocking, and expiries.
	Implement inventory control systems and maintain accurate stock records.
	Conduct regular stock counts, audits, and reconciliations.
	Track expiry dates and ensure proper stock rotation (FIFO/FEFO).
	Coordinate procurement activities with vendors and internal departments.
	Ensure compliance with healthcare standards, regulatory guidelines, and safety policies.
	Oversee storage conditions for pharmaceuticals and medical items (temperature, handling, labeling).


Requirements &amp; Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Pharmacy, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in inventory management within a healthcare or pharmaceutical setting.
	Strong knowledge of medical inventory systems and healthcare supply chain processes.
	Experience using inventory management software (ERP systems preferred).
	Understanding of regulatory requirements for healthcare inventory management.
	Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.


Salary
N450,000 / Month.",

Inventory and Warehouse Lead (Healthcare) Job at Castville Solutions




        
    

        
        Castville Solutions is a recruitment and business solutions provider specializing in the healthcare sector. We focus on connecting healthcare facilities with highly skilled professionals, enabling efficient operations, and driving business growth. Our services extend to recruitment, Templates for process and operations management, SOP development, and healthcare-specific training, with a clear mission to transform the healthcare workforce and operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory and Warehouse Lead (Healthcare)

Job Location: Gbagada, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Inventory Manager will be responsible for overseeing and controlling the procurement, storage, distribution, and tracking of medical supplies, pharmaceuticals, equipment, and consumables.
	The role ensures optimal stock levels, compliance with healthcare regulations, reduction of wastage, and uninterrupted availability of critical healthcare items.


Key Responsibilities


	Manage daily inventory operations for medical supplies, drugs, equipment, and consumables.
	Monitor stock levels to prevent shortages, overstocking, and expiries.
	Implement inventory control systems and maintain accurate stock records.
	Conduct regular stock counts, audits, and reconciliations.
	Track expiry dates and ensure proper stock rotation (FIFO/FEFO).
	Coordinate procurement activities with vendors and internal departments.
	Ensure compliance with healthcare standards, regulatory guidelines, and safety policies.
	Oversee storage conditions for pharmaceuticals and medical items (temperature, handling, labeling).


Requirements & Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Pharmacy, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 3 years of experience in inventory management within a healthcare or pharmaceutical setting.
	Strong knowledge of medical inventory systems and healthcare supply chain processes.
	Experience using inventory management software (ERP systems preferred).
	Understanding of regulatory requirements for healthcare inventory management.
	Strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.


Salary
N450,000 / Month.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Cashier / Inventory Officer",
  "description": "Salpha Energy is a renewable energy company determined to provide affordable solar solutions for everyone. We are addressing the huge market need for energy by enabling people harness the infinite source of light that freely accessible to everyone.&nbsp;Innovations in renewable technology afford us the opportunity to place power back in the hands of people, through innovative and quality conscious products that are built to last for outdoor campaing, entrepreneurial activities, rural settlements or disaster relief.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier / Inventory Officer

Job Location:&nbsp;Enugu
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview


	As the Cashier/Inventory Officers you play a dual role in managing both cash transactions and inventory control at the branch or outlet level.
	You would ensure accuracy in financial dealings, transparency in stock movement, and accountability for all cash and product-related activities.
	Your position is critical to maintaining operational efficiency, preventing losses, and supporting the company&rsquo;s goal and objectives by facilitating financial transactions and sales through dealers and partnership operations.


Key Responsibilities
Cash Management:


	Receive payments (cash, POS, transfers) from customers and issue receipts accurately.
	Record all daily financial transactions in the approved system (on the location&rsquo;s drive and sheets) and ensure reconciliation at close of business.
	Maintain accurate record of all transactions within the outlet for both dealership and partner&rsquo;s sales.
	Maintain accurate record of all expenses within the branch office with accompanying evidence/document.
	Monitor transactions with partners (LAPO &amp; Grooming), ensuring all sales are supported with valid and error free documentation.
	Maintain confidentiality and integrity in handling company funds and client financial data.
	Track sales transactions and report any discrepancies to the management.


Inventory Management:


	Maintain accurate records of all stock received, issued, transferred, or sold at the outlet.
	Conduct physical stock counts and reconcile discrepancies with the system or stock register/sheet maintained on the drive.
	Ensure all product movements (inbound and outbound) are properly documented with SIV (signed delivery notes, stock issue forms, or transfer forms).
	Work closely with the sales, logistics and warehouse team to update stock balances in real-time.
	Monitor inventory levels and raise timely replenishment requests to avoid stockouts.
	Ensure the storage area is clean, organized, and compliant with safety and product preservation standards.
	Track defective or returned products and ensure proper documentation for repairs or warranty processing.
	Work with the sales and engineering team to ensure all defectives are prompting repaired and returned to the customer.
	Escalate any financial, sales or stock irregularities immediately to the Account team lead and management.
	Track sales order and supplies to partners to confirm quatity ordered versus quality supplied.


Other Important Functions:


	Conduct reconciliation for LAPO before product disbursement.
	Maintain up-to-date records of all sales and inventory transactions for audit purposes.
	Provide courteous and efficient service to walk-in customers, dealers, and partner representatives.
	Collaborate with the Partnership financial accountant to validate payment for disbursement made.
	Adhere and ensure full compliance of all company&rsquo;s financial policies within the outlet.


Key Qualities Expected


	Appearance and Dress:&nbsp;The Cashier/Inventory Officer will be clean and neatly attired while on duty in a manner befitting of your position.
	Teamwork &ndash;&nbsp;Ability to work within a diverse team (SOs, PIDOs, Technicians, partner reps etc) with the aim of actualizing organizational goal above personal gains.
	An eye for details.
	Computer Literate and continuous up skilling.
	Good knowledge of Inventory Management.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work effectively under pressure to meet deadlines.
	Result and service orientation.
	Ability to multi-task effectively.


Core Values Alignment:


	Integrity: Uphold transparency and accountability in all dealings.
	Customer Focus: Ensure prompt, polite, and professional service.
	Discipline: Adhere strictly to financial and operational policies.
	Teamwork: Collaborate effectively with sales, finance, Engineering and logistics teams.


Benefits


	We offer a captivating and varied function with an organisation driven by its mission and where initiative, creativity, and energy are strongly encouraged.
	Competitive remuneration aligned with industry standards.
	Opportunity to work in a mission-driven, high-impact organization in the renewable energy space.
	Exposure to a multicultural, dynamic work environment.
	Professional growth opportunities across communications, partnerships, strategy and leadership.
	A supportive, collaborative team culture that encourages creativity, innovation, and ownership.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;salpha@salphaenergy.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.",
  "datePosted": "2026-01-14",
  "validThrough": "2026-02-15",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Salpha Energy Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",

      "@type": "PostalAddress",

      "addressCountry": "NG"

Cashier / Inventory Officer Job at Salpha Energy Limited




        
    

        
        Salpha Energy is a renewable energy company determined to provide affordable solar solutions for everyone. We are addressing the huge market need for energy by enabling people harness the infinite source of light that freely accessible to everyone. Innovations in renewable technology afford us the opportunity to place power back in the hands of people, through innovative and quality conscious products that are built to last for outdoor campaing, entrepreneurial activities, rural settlements or disaster relief.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Cashier / Inventory Officer

Job Location: Enugu
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Overview
     

            
    




	As the Cashier/Inventory Officers you play a dual role in managing both cash transactions and inventory control at the branch or outlet level.
	You would ensure accuracy in financial dealings, transparency in stock movement, and accountability for all cash and product-related activities.
	Your position is critical to maintaining operational efficiency, preventing losses, and supporting the company’s goal and objectives by facilitating financial transactions and sales through dealers and partnership operations.


Key Responsibilities
Cash Management:


	Receive payments (cash, POS, transfers) from customers and issue receipts accurately.
	Record all daily financial transactions in the approved system (on the location’s drive and sheets) and ensure reconciliation at close of business.
	Maintain accurate record of all transactions within the outlet for both dealership and partner’s sales.
	Maintain accurate record of all expenses within the branch office with accompanying evidence/document.
	Monitor transactions with partners (LAPO & Grooming), ensuring all sales are supported with valid and error free documentation.
	Maintain confidentiality and integrity in handling company funds and client financial data.
	Track sales transactions and report any discrepancies to the management.


Inventory Management:


	Maintain accurate records of all stock received, issued, transferred, or sold at the outlet.
	Conduct physical stock counts and reconcile discrepancies with the system or stock register/sheet maintained on the drive.
	Ensure all product movements (inbound and outbound) are properly documented with SIV (signed delivery notes, stock issue forms, or transfer forms).
	Work closely with the sales, logistics and warehouse team to update stock balances in real-time.
	Monitor inventory levels and raise timely replenishment requests to avoid stockouts.
	Ensure the storage area is clean, organized, and compliant with safety and product preservation standards.
	Track defective or returned products and ensure proper documentation for repairs or warranty processing.
	Work with the sales and engineering team to ensure all defectives are prompting repaired and returned to the customer.
	Escalate any financial, sales or stock irregularities immediately to the Account team lead and management.
	Track sales order and supplies to partners to confirm quatity ordered versus quality supplied.


Other Important Functions:


	Conduct reconciliation for LAPO before product disbursement.
	Maintain up-to-date records of all sales and inventory transactions for audit purposes.
	Provide courteous and efficient service to walk-in customers, dealers, and partner representatives.
	Collaborate with the Partnership financial accountant to validate payment for disbursement made.
	Adhere and ensure full compliance of all company’s financial policies within the outlet.


Key Qualities Expected


	Appearance and Dress: The Cashier/Inventory Officer will be clean and neatly attired while on duty in a manner befitting of your position.
	Teamwork – Ability to work within a diverse team (SOs, PIDOs, Technicians, partner reps etc) with the aim of actualizing organizational goal above personal gains.
	An eye for details.
	Computer Literate and continuous up skilling.
	Good knowledge of Inventory Management.
	Good communication and interpersonal skills.
	Ability to work effectively under pressure to meet deadlines.
	Result and service orientation.
	Ability to multi-task effectively.


Core Values Alignment:


	Integrity: Uphold transparency and accountability in all dealings.
	Customer Focus: Ensure prompt, polite, and professional service.
	Discipline: Adhere strictly to financial and operational policies.
	Teamwork: Collaborate effectively with sales, finance, Engineering and logistics teams.


Benefits


	We offer a captivating and varied function with an organisation driven by its mission and where initiative, creativity, and energy are strongly encouraged.
	Competitive remuneration aligned with industry standards.
	Opportunity to work in a mission-driven, high-impact organization in the renewable energy space.
	Exposure to a multicultural, dynamic work environment.
	Professional growth opportunities across communications, partnerships, strategy and leadership.
	A supportive, collaborative team culture that encourages creativity, innovation, and ownership.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: salpha@salphaenergy.com using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply
